perturbation.original_text: The Company shall ensure that all goods and services provided by the Company, under or in association with any of the Seller Licensed Trademarks, shall (i) be substantially the same as or greater than the quality of goods and services provided under such Seller Licensed Trademarks immediately prior to the Effective Date and (ii) not be associated with any goods or services, including any activities, that are reasonably likely to have an adverse effect on (A) the image or reputation of any of the Seller Licensed Trademarks or (B) Seller's right, title or interest in and to, any of the Arizona Licensed Trademarks.
perturbation.changed_text: The Company shall ensure that all goods and services provided by the Company, under or in association with any of the Seller Licensed Trademarks, shall not be associated with any goods or services, including any activities.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the quality assurance clause, the contract neglects to protect the trademark's integrity, potentially misleading consumers about the consistency and standards associated with the licensed trademarks. This omission can be considered deceptive trade practice under the Delaware Deceptive Trade Practices Act, which demands certain quality control standards for licensed products to protect consumers.

perturbation.original_text: In addition to the obligations set forth in Section 6.3, and notwithstanding any other provision of this Agreement, the Company shall comply with all obligations applicable to Arizona and its Affiliates under the Trademark License Agreement including, for the avoidance of doubt, any obligations with respect to reporting Complaints (as defined in the Trademark License Agreement), which reports the Company shall provide to Arizona, and quality control and standards, and Licensor Competitors (as defined in the Trademark License Agreement), and neither Party shall undertake any act that would constitute a breach or a basis for termination under the Trademark License Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Notwithstanding any other provision of this Agreement, neither Party shall undertake any act that would constitute a breach or a basis for termination under the Trademark License Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The omission of the clause mandating the Company's compliance with obligations applicable to Arizona under the Trademark License Agreement, including reporting complaints and adhering to quality control standards, creates a legal contradiction. By not explicitly requiring the Company to report complaints, the contract weakens consumer protection measures related to trademark usage. This introduces legal risk by potentially violating the Lanham Act, which emphasizes the importance of trademark owners ensuring consistent quality of goods and services associated with the mark.

perturbation.original_text: Each Party (the "Indemnifying Party") agrees to indemnify, defend and hold harmless the other Party and its Affiliates and their respective employees, directors, officers, agents and successors (collectively, the "Indemnified Parties") from and against any and all losses (including all costs, liabilities (including present and future damages), claims and expenses) incurred or suffered by any of the Indemnified Parties, to the extent arising out of, relating to or resulting from (a) a breach by the Indemnifying Party of this Agreement; or (b) any gross negligence or willful misconduct of the Indemnifying Party in connection with this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Each Party (the "Indemnifying Party") agrees to indemnify the other Party from and against losses arising out of a breach by the Indemnifying Party of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the explicit mention of defending and holding harmless the other party and its affiliates, including employees, directors, and officers, and restricting the indemnification to only cover losses directly from a breach, the contract weakens the scope of protection available to the Indemnified Parties. This omission introduces legal risk under Delaware law regarding corporate officer and director liability. Delaware law provides certain protections and indemnification rights to corporate officers and directors, and weakening the indemnification clause could conflict with these implied legal protections.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Delaware General Corporation Law regarding indemnification of officers and directors
